summary: August 30 is the 242nd day of the year  in the Gregorian calendar.
full_text:
Captain Samuel Frederick Henry "Siffy" Thompson MC DFC was a World War I two-seater fighter ace who, in conjunction with his observer-gunners, was credited with 30 victories . He was shot down and killed in action on 27 September 1918. Despite having an active fighter career of only five months, he reached the rank of Captain and won two British military decorations.
^ a b "The Aerodrome: Samuel Thompson". 1997. Retrieved 2008-12-06. 
^ Guttman, Jon . Bristol F.2 Fighter Aces. Osprey Publishing. p. 29. ISBN 1-84603-201-6.
title: Samuel Frederick Henry Thompson
